context_of_use: The customer interacts with the e-commerce platform to add products to their cart and complete the checkout process.
scope: The use case covers the process of selecting products, adding them to a cart, and completing the purchase through various payment methods.
description: Enable customers to add products to a cart and complete checkout using available payment methods.
preconditions: Customer is logged into their account.
Customer has selected products to purchase.
postconditions: Customer receives confirmation of the order.
assumptions: Customer has a valid payment method.
requirements_met: Customer can add products to the cart.
Customer can select a payment method during checkout.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects products → System adds products to the cart.
2. Customer proceeds to checkout → System displays payment options.
3. Customer selects payment method → System processes the payment.
4. System confirms order → Customer receives order confirmation.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): Customer cancels the checkout process → System returns to the cart.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): Payment fails → System notifies customer and prompts for a different payment method.
information_for_steps: 1. Product details including price and availability.
3. Confirmation details including order number and estimated delivery.
